newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech telecoms affected by flooding.
newsitem.headline: Czech telecoms affected by flooding.

text.p: Czech telephone operator SPT Telecom a.s. said on Tuesday that a maximum of 100,000 fixed lines had been interrupted by massive flooding in the eastern part of the country.

SPT said in a statement that it was still too early to "calculate any financial sums" as a result of the flooding, but that the lines affected represent only three percent of SPT's total number of lines in operation.
The worst flooding this century has indundated the eastern part of the Czech Republic for over a week, caused damage put at 100 billion crowns and killed at least 39 people.
The flood wave interrupted rail and road connection in the affected regions as well as gas, power as well as telephone links.
The Czech parliament has approved an issuance of up to five billion in flood bonds and release another up to five billion from privatisation proceeds for flood relief.

In June 1995, the Czech government chose a joint bid from the TelSource consortium formed by Koninklijke PTT Nederland and Swiss Telecom, from among five global telecom bids for a 27 percent stake, and effective operating control of the firm.
The group -- split between 51 percent for the Dutch PTT, and 49 percent for Swiss Telecom -- paid $1.32 billion for the shares, plus an additional $131 million in training services and technology.
SPT shares traded up 72 crowns to 3,552 at the daily price fixing on the Prague Stock Exchange on Tuesday.
